text: One way to avoid this problem would be for private registry owners to also register matching dummy version 0.0.1 packages in General. This would of course be a terrible use of General in every other way than for that purpose, so better not have that happen. A possible alternative would be to have some service that allows submitting UUIDs (without matching package names) that should not be allowed to be registered in General. That of course has its own set of problems but may be worth considering.

text: requiring (name, UUID) of internal stuff to be made public is terrible information leakage.
